content: How can I automatically activate a virtual environment in Visual Studio Code? I tried adding the line "terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows": ["source${workspaceFolder}\env\Scripts\activate"] to my settings.json file, but it throws me an error code 127, which means 'Not found'. However, I can see my venv folder clearly. I'm using Windows 10 with the Git Bash terminal installed. What could be the problem?
